intro: Solanum jaenense, commonly known as the Jaén tomato, is a species of nightshade native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are typically pubescent. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are often used in traditional Mediterranean cuisine. It thrives in dry, warm climates and is adapted to poor soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
